title: A single user can subscribe a community multiple times

profile.name: Liberapay
profile.about: An open source platform designed to facilitate recurrent donations.

vulnerability_information:
There is no proper validation while subscribing for a community. A user can subscribe a single community multiple times.

Steps to recreate:
Step 1: Open any community
Step 2: Click on subscribe button
Step 3: Capture the POST request and submit it multiple times
Step 4: Check the subscription count

POST Request:
--------------------------------
POST /for/nocommunity/subscribe HTTP/1.1
Host: liberapay.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:45.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/45.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: https://liberapay.com/for/nocommunity
Cookie: __cfduid=d5a7372c0620f73d866bac0869443206a1528250205; csrf_token=hmxFrGGb7FULfeeMuDIIamnotahacker; session="163767:1:VTi89XOnmnZWYLXMBlE8G_a_8gZCZAz5"
Connection: close
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 43

csrf_token=hmxFrGGb7FULfeeMuDIIamnotahacker

Response:
--------------------
HTTP/1.1 302 Found
Date: Wed, 06 Jun 2018 02:11:26 GMT
Connection: close
[TRUNCATED]

## Impact

Any user can increase his/her community subscriber's count to any number.

activities.message:
Thank you for the report. We are having some difficulties understanding the impact of this vulnerability. While it looks like this behaves as described, can you explain what an attacker can obtain out of this? When writing your response, I recommend that you see for the business impact that can affect either the business or the user. In more general terms the main question is:

* What can this bug do?
* Can you grab someone’s confidential information?
* Change their information?
* Change your user permission from a low-level user to an owner?
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you for the report. We are having some difficulties understanding the impact of this vulnerability. While it looks like this behaves as described, can you explain what an attacker can obtain out of this? When writing your response, I recommend that you see for the business impact that can affect either the business or the user. In more general terms the main question is:

  • What can this bug do?
  • Can you grab someone’s confidential information?
  • Change their information?
  • Change your user permission from a low-level user to an owner?

activities.message: It won't disclose any confidential information.  But would allow a community owner to increase it's community subscriber's count to any number without actual user subscribing it.
activities.markdown_message: It won't disclose any confidential information. But would allow a community owner to increase it's community subscriber's count to any number without actual user subscribing it.

activities.message: Thank you for your submission! We have received your report and a security analyst will respond shortly.
activities.markdown_message: Thank you for your submission! We have received your report and a security analyst will respond shortly.

activities.message:
Hi @mks11nov,

Thank you for you report, this is probably more of a design issue than a security vulnerability. I do think that this wasn't intended behaviour, so I'm discussing this with other triage members to see what they think.

Thanks,
Karel.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @mks11nov,

Thank you for you report, this is probably more of a design issue than a security vulnerability. I do think that this wasn't intended behaviour, so I'm discussing this with other triage members to see what they think.

Thanks,
Karel.

activities.message:
@mks11nov What you've found is a valid bug, but not really a security vulnerability, so I've opened an issue for it on GitHub: <https://github.com/liberapay/liberapay.com/issues/1136>.

I am closing this report as Informative so as not to affect your reputation.
